trans-unit.source: Get started with authentication (Windows Phone) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with authentication (Windows Phone) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Windows Phone app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Windows Phone app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is also demonstrated by Nick Harris in the following video:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is also demonstrated by Nick Harris in the following video:

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: You must also first complete the tutorial [Add Mobile Services to an existing app].
trans-unit.target: You must also first complete the tutorial [Add Mobile Services to an existing app].

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the authentication flow managed by Mobile Services using a variety of identity providers.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the authentication flow managed by Mobile Services using a variety of identity providers.

trans-unit.source: This method is easy to configure and supports multiple providers.
trans-unit.target: This method is easy to configure and supports multiple providers.

trans-unit.source: To instead use Live Connect with client-managed authentication and provide a single sign-on experience in your Windows Phone app, see the topic [Single sign-on for Windows Phone apps by using Live Connect].
trans-unit.target: To instead use Live Connect with client-managed authentication and provide a single sign-on experience in your Windows Phone app, see the topic [Single sign-on for Windows Phone apps by using Live Connect].

trans-unit.source: By using client-managed authentication, your app has access to additional user data maintained by the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: By using client-managed authentication, your app has access to additional user data maintained by the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: You can get the same user data in your mobile service by by calling the user.getIdentities() function in server scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can get the same user data in your mobile service by by calling the user.getIdentities() function in server scripts.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>this post</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>this post</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: 3.
trans-unit.target: 3.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows Phone, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial <linkText>Add Mobile Services to an existing app</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows Phone, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial <linkText>Add Mobile Services to an existing app</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: 4.
trans-unit.target: 4.

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run this quickstart-based app; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run this quickstart-based app; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the TodoItem table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the TodoItem table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, <linkText>Service-side authorization of Mobile Services users</linkText><title></title>, you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, <linkText>Service-side authorization of Mobile Services users</linkText><title></title>, you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
